articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives On-the-spot Guidance to Moranbong Theatre
DPRK Founding Anniversary Celebrated
Rodong Sinmun on Line of Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Line of Independent Reunification 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article stresses that the line of the Workers' Party of Korea to achieve independent reunification of the country is consistent and steadfast.
 When President Kim Il Sung met the delegates of the south side who came here to participate in the high-level political talks between the north and the south of Korea in May Juche 61 (1972), he put forth the three principles of national reunification the main content of which is to achieve national reunification independently without reliance on the foreign forces or free from foreign interference. And he set forth a proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo at the historic 6th Congress of the WPK in October Juche 69 (1980).    
 The WPK's line of independent reunification has been invariably maintained along with the firm inheritance of the leadership, the article says, and goes on:
 Leader Kim Jong Il in his famous work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" solemnly clarified his iron will to carry forward the noble intention of the President to accomplish the cause of independent reunification at any cost. His firm will is reflected in the June 15 joint declaration that the north and the south shall achieve national reunification independently by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation itself.
 The Korean nation is vigorously struggling to defend the joint declaration and put it into practice and pioneering a history of national reconciliation and unity, peace and reunification, pushing aside the vicious obstructive moves of the anti-reunification forces, true to the noble idea and lofty intention of Kim Jong Il who provided the great declaration of independent reunification reflecting the requirements of the times and the desire of the nation.    
 The leadership of the WPK upholding the great banner of independent reunification constitutes the main motive force of developing inter-Korean relations and reunification movement and firmly guarantees the accomplishment of the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Congratulations to First Vice-President of Iran
articles.content:
Congratulations to First Vice-President of Iran 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Parviz Davudi upon his appointment as first vice-president of Iran.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will further expand and develop in various fields, Pak in the message wholeheartedly wished the first vice-president success in his new job for national prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Malian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Malian President 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Amadou Toumani Toure, president and head of state of Mali, on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic of Mali.
 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would further expand in the future, the message sincerely wished the Malian president and people great successes in their work for national socio-economic development and regional peace and stability.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Mats Foyer, Swedish ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, presented his credentials to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 On hand were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and a staff member of the Swedish embassy here.    
 After receiving the credentials, the president conversed with the ambassador.

articles.title: Thrice World Judo Champion Welcomed
articles.content:
Thrice World Judo Champion Welcomed 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the People's Palace of Culture Monday to welcome People's Sportswoman Kye Sun Hui who is Kim Il Sung Prize winner, Labor Hero and thrice world judo champion.
 Addressing the meeting, Mun Jae Dok, chairman of the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, said that she has become Kim Il Sung Prize winner, labor hero, people's sportswoman and thrice world judo champion and "world judo queen" of Songun Korea well known to the world entirely thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and his warm care.    
 He underlined the need for all officials in the field of sports and sportspersons to prepare themselves as true sportspersons winning gold medals to please the Workers' Party of Korea, the mother party, and demonstrating the dignity and honor of the country, true to the Party's idea of sports and its leadership over it.
 Kim Tang Su, director of the Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs who is chairman of the DPRK Judo Association, Hong Sok Yong, head of the Amnokgang Sports Group, Ri Kwang Hak, secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League in their congratulatory speeches said that the success achieved by Kye Sun Hui clearly testified to the validity and vitality of the WPK's Juche-based policy of sports, praising her as an admirable daughter of Korea and pride of the nation as she held the world title again, stunning the world judo circle in this century.
 Kye Sun Hui in her reply said that it is Kim Jong Il who has given her strength, courage, matchless gut and pluck, adding that the unbounded love and trust always bestowed upon her by him have served as nutrition and source of strength that enabled her to emerge winner in world championships in succession and demonstrate the honor as a thrice world judo champion.    
 She renewed her firm pledge to win victories in the future, too, cherishing as immutable truth the faith that one is sure to win under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
 The meeting was attended by Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and others, sportspersons and working people in the city.

articles.title: Libyan People's Bureau Secretary Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Libyan People's Bureau Secretary Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the People's Bureau of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya to the DPRK, Monday hosted a reception on the occasion of the 36th anniversary of the Great September First Revolution in Libya.
 Speeches were made at the reception.    
 Present on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the C. C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea who is chairman of the DPRK-Libya Friendship Association, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
 On hand were staff members of the people's bureau.
